getInputStream

public static java.io.InputStream getInputStream(java.lang.String filename)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
Get a normal input stream or a gzip input stream depending on whether filename's extension is ".gz".

If the filename is of the form a:b and b doesn't start with a '/', then assume 'a' is a class and 'b' is a resource relative to that class.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

                                          throws java.io.IOException

touch

public static final boolean touch(java.lang.String path)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Ensure a file exists at the given path.

If it already exists, do nothing; if it does not exist, then create an empty file at path.

Returns:
true if the file was created; otherwise, false.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

                                              boolean create)
Convert input file to output file by
  • taking name up to first '.',
  • making a directory under the input file's dir
  • creating output file with same name as input but in the new directory.

readStrings

public static final int readStrings(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> result,
                                    java.io.File file,
                                    java.lang.String splitPattern,
                                    int[] keeperColumns,
                                    java.lang.String ignoreStartString,
                                    boolean ignoreBlankStrings,
                                    boolean ignoreFirstLine)
                             throws java.io.IOException
Read strings from the given file.

Parameters:
result - The collector for read strings.
file - The name of the file to load strings from.
splitPattern - The pattern to split lines into columns, or null if each line is a string to read.
keeperColumns - The columns after splitting to keep strings from, or null if all columns are to be kept.
ignoreStartString - Pattern for lines to ignore when they start with this string or null to keep all lines.
ignoreBlankStrings - If true, blank strings will not be added to the results.
ignoreFirstLine - If true, the first line will be ignored.
Returns:
the number of strings read from the file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readAsString

public static java.lang.String readAsString(java.lang.String filename,
                                            FileUtil.LineIgnorer lineIgnorer)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
Read in the entire file as a string.

Parameters:
filename - - File to read from
lineIgnorer - - Designates lines to ignore. Don't ignore any if null.
Returns:
a string with the file contents
Throws:
java.io.IOException

lineIgnorer - - Designates lines to ignore. Don't ignore any if null.

getLastLines

public static java.lang.String[] getLastLines(java.io.File file)
Get the last (non-empty, up to 1K) lines of the file.

This implementation uses a RandomAccessFile to jump near the end of the file instead of iterating through the entire file.

Note that for ".gz" files, this method will not work while that implemented in getLastLines2 will; however, this method calls getLastLines2 if the file ends with ".gz" so it can be used in any case.

getLastLines2

public static java.lang.String[] getLastLines2(java.io.File file,
                                               int numLines)
Get the last (non-empty) lines by reading through the entire file and just keeping up to the last N (non-empty) lines.

Note that for ".gz" files, this method will work while getLastLines will not.

getFreeDiskSpace

public static final long getFreeDiskSpace(java.io.File file)
Get the amount of free disk space (in kilobytes) on the file's partition.

Returns:
the free disk space or -1 if the file doesn't exist or "df -k" failed.
